titles.title: Keeping Social Security Solvent Act of 2011
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the limitation on the imposition of employment taxes on wages in excess of the contribution and benefit base.
Keeping Social Security Solvent Act of 2011

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Keeping Social Security Solvent Act of 2011 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the taxes on employment and self-employment compensation, to repeal the limit on the amount of compensation subject to such taxes (i.e., the contribution and benefit base, currently $106,800 in 2011).
